trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to install and run MongoDB on a virtual machine running Windows Server.
trans-unit.target: Follow these steps to install and run MongoDB on a virtual machine running Windows Server.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] MongoDB security features, such as authentication and IP address binding, are not enabled by default.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] MongoDB security features, such as authentication and IP address binding, are not enabled by default.

trans-unit.source: Security features should be enabled before deploying MongoDB to a production environment.
trans-unit.target: Security features should be enabled before deploying MongoDB to a production environment.

trans-unit.source: See [Security and Authentication](http://www.mongodb.org/display/DOCS/Security+and+Authentication) for more information.
trans-unit.target: See [Security and Authentication](http://www.mongodb.org/display/DOCS/Security+and+Authentication) for more information.

trans-unit.source: After you've connected to the virtual machine using Remote Desktop, open Internet Explorer from the **Start** menu on the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: After you've connected to the virtual machine using Remote Desktop, open Internet Explorer from the **Start** menu on the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Select the **Tools** button in the upper right corner.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Tools** button in the upper right corner.

trans-unit.source: In **Internet Options**, select the **Security** tab, and then select the **Trusted Sites** icon, and finally click the **Sites** button.
trans-unit.target: In **Internet Options**, select the **Security** tab, and then select the **Trusted Sites** icon, and finally click the **Sites** button.

trans-unit.source: Add _http://\*.mongodb.org_ to the list of trusted sites.
trans-unit.target: Add _http://\*.mongodb.org_ to the list of trusted sites.

trans-unit.source: Go to [Downloads- MongoDB] [MongoDownloads].
trans-unit.target: Go to [Downloads- MongoDB] [MongoDownloads].

trans-unit.source: Find the **Current Stable Release**, select the latest **64-bit** version in the Windows column, download and run the MSI installer.
trans-unit.target: Find the **Current Stable Release**, select the latest **64-bit** version in the Windows column, download and run the MSI installer.

trans-unit.source: MongoDB is typically installed on C:\Program Files\MongoDB.
trans-unit.target: MongoDB is typically installed on C:\Program Files\MongoDB.

trans-unit.source: Search for Environment Variables on the desktop and add the MongoDB binaries path to the PATH variable.
trans-unit.target: Search for Environment Variables on the desktop and add the MongoDB binaries path to the PATH variable.

trans-unit.source: For example, you might find the binaries at C:\Program Files\MongoDB\Server\3.0\bin on your machine.
trans-unit.target: For example, you might find the binaries at C:\Program Files\MongoDB\Server\3.0\bin on your machine.

trans-unit.source: Now that MongoDB is installed and running, you'll need to open a port in Windows Firewall so you can remotely connect to MongoDB.
trans-unit.target: Now that MongoDB is installed and running, you'll need to open a port in Windows Firewall so you can remotely connect to MongoDB.

trans-unit.source: From the **Start** menu, select **Administrator Tools** and then **Windows Firewall with Advanced Security**.
trans-unit.target: From the **Start** menu, select **Administrator Tools** and then **Windows Firewall with Advanced Security**.

trans-unit.source: In the left pane, select **Inbound Rules**.
trans-unit.target: In the left pane, select **Inbound Rules**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Actions** pane on the right, select **New Rule...**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Actions** pane on the right, select **New Rule...**.

trans-unit.source: Windows Firewall
trans-unit.target: Windows Firewall

trans-unit.source: In the **New Inbound Rule Wizard**, select **Port** and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: In the **New Inbound Rule Wizard**, select **Port** and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Windows Firewall
trans-unit.target: Windows Firewall

trans-unit.source: Select **TCP** and then **Specific local ports**.
trans-unit.target: Select **TCP** and then **Specific local ports**.

trans-unit.source: Specify a port of "27017" (the default port MongoDB listens on) and click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Specify a port of "27017" (the default port MongoDB listens on) and click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Select **Allow the connection** and click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Allow the connection** and click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Next** again.
trans-unit.target: Click **Next** again.

trans-unit.source: Specify a name for the rule, such as "MongoPort", and click **Finish**.
trans-unit.target: Specify a name for the rule, such as "MongoPort", and click **Finish**.

trans-unit.source: If you didn't configure an endpoint for MongoDB when you created the virtual machine, you can do it now.
trans-unit.target: If you didn't configure an endpoint for MongoDB when you created the virtual machine, you can do it now.

trans-unit.source: You need both the firewall rule and the endpoint to be able to connect to MongoDB remotely.
trans-unit.target: You need both the firewall rule and the endpoint to be able to connect to MongoDB remotely.

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal, click **Virtual Machines**, click the name of your new virtual machine, and then click **Endpoints**.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal, click **Virtual Machines**, click the name of your new virtual machine, and then click **Endpoints**.

trans-unit.target: Endpoints

trans-unit.source: Click **Add** at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add** at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: Select **Add a Stand-Alone Endpoint** and click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Add a Stand-Alone Endpoint** and click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Endpoints
trans-unit.target: Endpoints

trans-unit.source: Add an endpoint with name "Mongo", protocol **TCP**, and both **Public** and **Private** ports set to "27017".
trans-unit.target: Add an endpoint with name "Mongo", protocol **TCP**, and both **Public** and **Private** ports set to "27017".

trans-unit.source: This will allow MongoDB to be accessed remotely.
trans-unit.target: This will allow MongoDB to be accessed remotely.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The port 27017 is the default port used by MongoDB.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The port 27017 is the default port used by MongoDB.

trans-unit.source: You can change this by the _--port_ subcommand when starting the mongod.exe server.
trans-unit.target: You can change this by the _--port_ subcommand when starting the mongod.exe server.
